metadata.title: USN-6272-1 -- OpenJDK 20 vulnerabilities
metadata.description: Motoyasu Saburi discovered that OpenJDK 20 incorrectly handled special characters in file name parameters. An attacker could possibly use this issue to insert, edit or obtain sensitive information. (CVE-2023-22006)  Eirik Bjørsnøs discovered that OpenJDK 20 incorrectly handled certain ZIP archives. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service. (CVE-2023-22036)  David Stancu discovered that OpenJDK 20 had a flaw in the AES cipher implementation. An attacker could possibly use this issue to obtain sensitive information. (CVE-2023-22041)  Zhiqiang Zang discovered that OpenJDK 20 incorrectly handled array accesses when using the binary '%' operator. An attacker could possibly use this issue to obtain sensitive information. (CVE-2023-22044)  Zhiqiang Zang discovered that OpenJDK 20 incorrectly handled array accesses. An attacker could possibly use this issue to obtain sensitive information. (CVE-2023-22045)  It was discovered that OpenJDK 20 incorrectly sanitized URIs strings. An attacker could possibly use this issue to insert, edit or obtain sensitive information. (CVE-2023-22049)  It was discovered that OpenJDK 20 incorrectly handled certain glyphs. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service. (CVE-2023-25193)  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-6272-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  openjdk-20-jre - 20.0.2+9+ds1-0ubuntu1~23.04 openjdk-20-jre-zero - 20.0.2+9+ds1-0ubuntu1~23.04 openjdk-20-jre-headless - 20.0.2+9+ds1-0ubuntu1~23.04 openjdk-20-demo - 20.0.2+9+ds1-0ubuntu1~23.04 openjdk-20-jdk - 20.0.2+9+ds1-0ubuntu1~23.04 openjdk-20-source - 20.0.2+9+ds1-0ubuntu1~23.04 openjdk-20-doc - 20.0.2+9+ds1-0ubuntu1~23.04 openjdk-20-jdk-headless - 20.0.2+9+ds1-0ubuntu1~23.04 No subscription required
